mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Marquis de Chastellux, 1783 October 12
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: After successfully commanding the Army, George Washington discusses his strong desire to retire and 'quit the walks of public life, and under my own vine, & my own Fig Tree, to seek those enjoyments, and that relaxation..' He concludes the letter with updates on the state of independence and his continued travels to explore western lands. Autographed letter signed, 4 pages. Stamped 'Archives de Chastellux.' Transmissive scan of watermark.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783
